item.title: Stock Futures Edge Higher
item.description: Investors’ attention is turning back to inflation this week, with the consumer-price index for July due Wednesday.

item.title: Stock Futures Edge Higher
item.description: Investors’ attention is turning back to inflation this week, with the consumer-price index for July due Wednesday.

item.title: Gilt Yields Relatively Steady Ahead of Key Data Releases This Week
item.description: Gilt yields are relatively steady as investors await major data releases this week including U.K. labor market data on Tuesday, and U.K. and U.S. inflation data on Wednesday.

item.title: Oil Edges Higher as Markets Brace for Iran Retaliation
item.description: Oil prices edged higher as markets continued to closely monitor geopolitical risks, with Iran’s retaliation against Israel in response to the killing of Hamas’s political leader believed to be imminent.

item.title: Sterling Could Fall if Key U.K. Data Miss Forecasts
item.description: Sterling could fall as U.K. employment and inflation data later in the week might come in slightly below expectations, potentially boosting BOE interest-rate cut expectations, ING said.

item.title: India's Bharti to Buy Altice Stake in BT
item.description: Bharti has agreed to buy a 24.5% stake in BT from Altice for an undisclosed amount, but said it had no intention of making an offer for the U.K. telecom group.

item.title: Gold Fields to Buy Canadian Miner Osisko
item.description: Gold Fields is set to buy Osisko Mining for $1.6 billion, giving the South African company full control of the Windfall project in Canada as it seeks to secure supply with gold prices soaring.

item.title: China's Central Bank to Examine Financial Institutions' Bond Risks
item.description: The People’s Bank of China is set to conduct stress tests on financial institutions’ exposure to bond holdings, in the latest effort to rein in a monthslong rally and prevent fallout risks.

item.title: Kamala Harris Taps California Roots---and Elite Donors---to Boost Election Bid
item.description: The fundraiser drew $12 million and 700 people, including bigwigs from Silicon Valley.

item.title: In Syria's Hinterlands, the U.S. Wages a Hidden Campaign Against a Resurgent Islamic State
item.description: Defeated by American-led forces half a decade ago, the terrorist group is rebounding amid the chaos of the Middle East.

item.title: Investors Borrowed Like Crazy During the Rally. Now They're Paying the Price.
item.description: Behind the market tumult of the past month: the rapid unwind of several popular trades and the heavy use of leverage

item.title: Ukraine's Russia Incursion Faces Dilemma After Quick Gains
item.description: Following a year of brutal defensive warfare, Ukraine’s new operation has quickly taken territory in Russia’s Kursk province. But Kyiv’s forces are still outgunned and outnumbered in most places.

item.title: Died: Susan Wojcicki, 56, internet ad-tech pioneer.
item.description: Died: Susan Wojcicki, 56, internet ad-tech pioneer.

item.title: San Francisco's hospitality business imploded during the Covid-19 pandemic and now the city's hotel owners are drowning in bad debt as never before.
item.description: San Francisco’s hospitality business imploded during the Covid-19 pandemic and now the city’s hotel owners are drowning in bad debt as never before.

item.title: North Texas is expanding its presence in financial services as banks and brokerages commission buildings in the state, accelerating the growth of what is known as Y'all Street.
item.description: North Texas is expanding its presence in financial services as banks and brokerages commission buildings in the state, accelerating the growth of what is known as Y’all Street.

item.title: Brazilian air-crash investigators combed over the remains of a twin-engine passenger plane a day after the aircraft stalled en route to São Paulo's biggest airport and spun to the ground in this affluent suburban community, killing all 62 people on board.
item.description: Brazilian air-crash investigators combed over the remains of a twin-engine passenger plane a day after the aircraft stalled en route to São Paulo’s biggest airport and spun to the ground in this affluent suburban community, killing all 62 people on board.

item.title: Newly released records offer the deepest look yet at the previously documented failures in response to the 2022 Uvalde, Texas, school shooting and the trauma inflicted on a community.
item.description: Newly released records offer the deepest look yet at the previously documented failures in response to the 2022 Uvalde, Texas, school shooting and the trauma inflicted on a community.

item.title: Investors retreating from the leveraged trades they recently used to bet on everything from crypto and foreign currencies to hot tech companies are setting up more potential upheaval in the markets.
item.description: Investors retreating from the leveraged trades they recently used to bet on everything from crypto and foreign currencies to hot tech companies are setting up more potential upheaval in the markets.

item.title: New York hospital system Northwell Health, which has provided locations for film shoots, recently established a production company of its own to work on more projects.
item.description: New York hospital system Northwell Health, which has provided locations for film shoots, recently established a production company of its own to work on more projects.

item.title: Israel's military killed dozens of civilians, Palestinian authorities and witnesses said, in an airstrike on a Gaza City school complex it said was used as a militant command post and as a shelter for displaced people.
item.description: Israel’s military killed dozens of civilians, Palestinian authorities and witnesses said, in an airstrike on a Gaza City school complex it said was used as a militant command post and as a shelter for displaced people.
